course_info: PHY203: ELEMENTARY PHYSICS I (Fall 2024) Instructor: Miquel Dorca, 211 East Hall, miquel@uri.edu Office Hours: MWF 12:30pm -1:00pm Lecture Time: 1pm-1:50pm (section 1), (East Hall Auditorium) Course Description: Calculus-based introduction to Newtonian mechanics. Kinematics and dynamics of particles and systems of particles, conservation laws, rotational motion, gravitation, and oscillatory motion. (Lec. 3) Pre: credit or concurrent enrollment in MTH 141 and concurrent enrollment in PHY 273. Intended for science and engineering majors. Text: University Physics (Open Stax), 1st Edition, Volume 1. University Physics from Open Stax is a free, open access textbook that can be found at https://openstax.org/subjects/science.
schedule: Lecture Times: MWF 1pm-1:50pm (East Hall Auditorium). Special asynchronous sessions on Brightspace: November 25th, 27th, December 2nd.
assignments: Homework Assignments: A set of homework problems will be due on or before (usually Wednesdays or Fridays) of almost every week (by 10 p.m.) and will be administered through WebAssign. WebAssign Class Key: uri 1373 1043. Due dates: Wed., Sept. 11 HW #1 due, Wed., Sept. 18 HW #2 due, Wed., Sept. 25 HW #3 due, Fri., Oct. 4 HW #4 due, Fri., Oct. 11 HW #5 due, Fri., Oct. 18 HW #6 due, Fri., Oct. 25 HW #7 due, Wed., Nov. 6 HW #8 due, Wed., Nov. 20 HW #9 due, Wed., Nov. 27 HW #10 due, Wed., Dec. 4 HW #11 due, Wed., Dec. 11 HW #12 due. After the due date, a 4 day extension with a 10 point penalty can be selected in WebAssign (available once only per assignment).
exams: Unit exams: unit #1 Chaps. 1,3,4 exam on Fri., 09/27; unit #2 Chaps. 5-8 exam on Fri., 10/25; unit #3 Chaps. 9-11,15 exam on Wed., 12/11. Final Exam Chaps. 1-11,15 TBA (The final exam will consist of 3 parts each corresponding to the 3 unit exams above). Exam Grading: If the score on a part of the final exam is higher than the score on the corresponding unit exam, it will replace the unit exam score when calculating semester grades.
readings: Readings: Wed., Sept. 11 Reading: Chapter 1, Wed., Sept. 18 Reading: Sections 3.1-3.5, Wed., Sept. 25 Reading: Sections 2.1-2.3, 4.1-4.3, Fri., Oct. 4 Reading: Chap. 5, Fri., Oct. 11 Reading: Sections 4.4, 6.1-6.3, Fri., Oct. 18 Reading: 1st part of Sec. 2.4, Chap. 7, Fri., Oct. 25 Reading: Chap. 8, Wed., Oct. 30 Reading: Sections 9.1-9.6, Wed., Nov. 13 Reading: Sections 10.1-10.6, Wed., Nov. 20 Reading: 2nd part of Sec. 2.4, Secs. 11-1-11.3, Wed., Nov. 27 Reading: Sections 13.1-13.5, Wed., Dec. 4 Reading: Sections 15.1,15.2,15.4, Wed., Dec. 11 Reading: Sections 15.1,15.2,15.4.
special_sessions: If the course needs to go remote (due to a weather cancellation, for instance) the lectures will be given asynchronously on Brightspace. This course will be taught in person (besides any possible weather-related cancellations). However, if there are no further notices, the course will be given asynchronously on Brightspace on the following three dates: November 25th, 27th, December 2nd.
